Text: Hyaaah!

...This mithril sword certainly cuts well. It's
beautifully crafted without any compromise
in qualityâ€”an impressive masterpiece.

Yes, indeed. This sword is perfectly balanced for
techniques of the Royal Bushin method, which has been
growing increasingly popular in the Midgar Kingdom.

The Royal Bushin method... That's different from my
sword technique.

This sword was crafted and designed to match the
"Royal Bushin" method. Are you planning to sell it
here in Vegalta as it is?

No, that was just an introduction. I wanted you to
test out this product!
Is this...a sharpening stone?

Indeed! It's a natural whetstone sourced from the
mountainous regions of Midgar. The sword just
now was sharpened using this very whetstone.

A natural one, huh... The knights of Velgalta
primarily rely on artificial whetstones due to
the quick wear and tear of their gearâ€”

Still, for top-tier dark knights like yourself, Lady
Annerose, utilizing a natural whetstone to refine
your blade will likely yield longer-lasting
sharpness!
There you go again with the flattery...

But you're right. When I sharpen my blade with the
available artificial whetstones, it simply can't
stand up to the demands of my techniques...

When I can't get my weapon professionally serviced,
perhaps it's worth considering a natural whetstone...

...Aren't they pricey, though? And with potential
fluctuation in stock, it could be an issue if they're
unavailable when I need oneâ€”

That's where Mitsugoshi offers a "subscription"
service for these natural whetstones!
Sub...scription? I'm not familiar with that term.

Right! Put simply, it means you can access and
utilize the product whenever you want by paying
a fixed monthly fee.

...It sounds economical for months when I use it
frequently...but I could potentially waste money
on the months I don't.

That's a legitimate concern. But for a distinguished
dark knight like yourself, Lady Annerose, who wields
her sword daily, going without a whetstone would be
unthinkable.

Also, we offer the initial month at no cost for those
signing up for the first time.

If you find it unsuitable or incompatible with your
equipment or preferences, you can cancel the
subscription or opt for a one-time purchase. We're
entirely flexible!

So it's essentially a trial period for the service...
Well played, Mitsugoshi.

Here's our price list. Please take a look. We also
offer a discounted annual subscription!
Oh, thank you...

(I'm not seeing any of the red flags noted in No. 111
and No. 122's reports. In fact, for a dark knight,
she seems considerably intellectual.)

(Her skills are evident, and I can clearly sense her
knowledge and tactics that maximize those skills...
No wonder she was chosen as one of Velgalta's Seven
Blades at such a young age.)

(She immediately grasped the idea of the subscription
and its potential pitfalls. It seems her expertise
extends beyond just the realm of sword technique.)

It might be a worthwhile investment if this ensures
my sword remains at its sharpest... In fact, the
convenience offered could very well outweigh the
expense.

Going forward, there will be more situations where
the condition of my weapon is crucial. I should make
sure it's always in top shape...
What do you mean by "situations"...?

Oh, I've been investigating an incident involving
Lady Karen von Herzog, a former member of
Velgalta's Seven Blades.

The official line is that Lady Karen, in a fit of
madness, took the lives of her own family and
subsequently renounced her position within
the Seven Blades before vanishing.

The empire largely accepts this narrative and has
formally tasked me, as Lady Karen's successor,
to investigate the matter. However...

I believe there's more to this story than meets the
eye.

The idea that Lady Karen, from the esteemed Herzog
family, known for her upright character, would just
snap and kill her family is absurd, don't you think?
R-Right...

(Wait, hold on! Isn't she being way too candid?!
Even if she isn't bound by confidentiality!)

(This isn't the kind of information you casually
share with a random merchant, especially one
you haven't formally conducted business with
and have no ties to!)

Also, while conducting my investigation, I was
attacked by a mysterious armed group.

Which means I'm getting closer to uncovering some
hidden truth.

(U-Um?! Hasn't she considered the possibility that I
approached her for business because I might be part
of that group?!)

I-In that case...it's important to ensure your
weapon is always in tip-top shape!
Yes...

...Alright, I think I'll sign up for the one-month
trial.

G-Got it! Thank you! We appreciate you choosing
Mitsugoshi...
Yes, ma'am.
I'm here.

...In our pursuit of Sergey and the Cult's secrets,
Annerose could serve as a potential scapegoat
for the Shadow Garden.

As I explained the other day, the Garden plans to
closely monitor her investigative activities and
exploit them to advance our ends.

But I hadn't expected her to be so unsuspecting,
or should I say, to be such an airhead!

While she's easy to manipulate, she seems utterly
oblivious to the grave danger she's in!

Like you said, No. 122, she's too good-hearted or
just way too indifferent to the malice that lurks in
the world!
So you understand now...!

The Cult's attack appears to have been thwarted, but
if this situation persists, the worst-case scenario
could come to pass.

Much like you feared, Lady Gamma, we must consider
the possibility of a direct attack by Sergey or the
mobilization of the Children.

It seems we must swiftly outline the key elements of
our strategy.

You two maintain close vigilance around Lady
Annerose. If she comes under attack, provide
support discreetly from the shadows.
Understood.
Copy that.

Until we finalize our strategy for leveraging her
investigation, it's essential to protect Annerose at
all costs... Understood?!
Yes, ma'am!
